intro: Gilia parvula, commonly known as the dwarf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Phlox family (Polemoniaceae) and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a compact, low-growing habit. Gilia parvula is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to arid conditions.
